Bees are incredibly territorial, and they will protect their hives with their lives.///If you see a beehive, steer clear unless you are looking for a fight.///However, if you do get in a scrap with a colony of bees, you may come home with a delicious prize.///By destroying a beehive, you can collect Honeycomb, a potent item capable of rendering you immune to all negative status effects, including poison, for a short time.///Adventurous cats will often take a bit of Honeycomb with them when they enter a dangerous place for protection. It's worth a try![/blue]///[purple]If you seek to achieve a goal, you must center your desires in the forefront of your mind. The clearer the image, the more likely the result.[/purple]
column2237: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about hunting today.///Not all prey is created equal! Some creatures are larger than others. Some creatures are more nourishing than others. And some creatures are more wily than others.///When you are hungry, it may take several mice to fill you up, but only one rabbit. You could also eat certain types of plants, but they tend to not be as satisfying as freshly-caught meat.///You can tell how rare a creature is prior to pouncing by the style and color of the hunting circle that hovers around it.///The rarer a creature, the more intelligent it will tend to be. Smart creatures are more difficult to catch, even by a well-trained hunter.///You may find it difficult to pounce on certain species because they can escape your claws easier than lesser critters.///In this case, it is important to approach as closely as you dare prior to leaping in order to give yourself the best possible chance at success. Happy hunting![/blue]///[purple]Thank yourself for slowing down and taking time to rest from the hustle and bustle of everyday living.[/purple]
column2238: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about difficulty levels today.///Every cat of the Wildwood lives with the blessing of the Forest Guardian, which enables us to achieve great things and helps us in our daily actions.///However, some cats would prefer to experience the challenges of life in the wilderness more acutely.///The Forest Guardian will not offer their blessing to a cat who refuses to accept it, and can also modulate how much help they will provide to you at any time based on your preference.///You can change your difficulty level by accessing the Options menu and selecting from one of five choices, ranging from easy to hard.///If you find life in the Wildwood too difficult, try lowering your difficulty level setting. Alternatively, if you find life in the Wildwood boring and easy, you might consider raising your difficulty level setting.///There is no right answer for what difficulty setting to pick. Choose one that works for you![/blue]///[purple]Adversity serves an important role in the formation of a great cat. Do not resist its presence in your life, but seek it out if you wish to progress.[/purple]
column2239: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about sleeping today.///Naturally, cats are accustomed to sleeping whenever it fits their schedule. Some cats prefer to sleep in the evening, when the world is dark, and others prefer sleeping in the day, when the sun is out.///You are free to sleep whenever you would like in order to recharge and reflect. You will find that sleeping has several benefits.///Small wounds may be healed by taking a few hours to relax in your den,///and by sleeping your brain has time to process and apply the lessons you've learned throughout your day, netting you some bonus experience points.///However, you will not gain such benefits if you sleep all the time! If you aren't tired, you will not heal nor gain experience points when you rest. Happy dreams![/blue]///[purple]Let peace be the anchor that stays your soul when others see their tempers flare.[/purple]
column2240: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about experience points today.///Cats are constantly learning, changing, and growing for the better. Our brains are made to absorb information, process it, and apply the important lessons we've learned to our everyday living.///As you hunt, fight, explore, forage, and live, you will naturally learn new things that will allow you to become a better cat and train new skills. You gain experience points by doing pretty much everything that matters.///By visiting a scratching post in your den, you can spend your hard-earned experience points in exchange for new Skills, special abilities that will give you an upper hand in a variety of situations.[/blue]///[purple]True success is the measure of how much progress you have made from where you stood yesterday. When you look back, do so gently and with limits.[/purple]
column2241: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about the stars today.///On a cloudless night, you may observe the reflection of the heavens in any pool of water. They are a dazzling sight to behold!///While their beauty is undeniable on any given day, you will want to pay special attention to the skies if you see a meteor shower filling the night sky.///A meteor shower is known to be a good omen that will surely grant you good luck while it is in progress.///But what are the stars? And what are the meteors? Some mysteries I cannot reveal, even to you. You will learn in time.[/blue]///[purple]If you know who you are, set your paws firmly in place. Bliss will follow soon.[/purple]
column2242: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about combat today.///In a perfect world, a cat would never need to unsheathe their claws and come to blows with another creature. But this is the Wildwood, and danger is all around.///You must be wary as you travel through the world so that you will not be caught off guard by an unseen foe.///When a fight is about to break out, you have two basic options. The first is to simply flee. No enemy will pursue you for long if you leave the area, because most creatures are territorial by nature.///There's usually a good chance to escape combat before it even begins if that is your preference.///The other option is to engage and try to win the brawl with your strength. Use your claws, but also use your brain!///It is important that you make use of your environment and your dexterity when fighting. It is not enough to simply stand still and keep slashing until you win. That is a great way to become severely injured.///If you get into a battle, I wish you all the best of luck! Remember what I taught you.[/blue]///[purple]You have a beautiful soul. Others will recognize it in you and give thanks for your presence in their lives.[/purple]
column2243: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about Skills today.///You can train your Skills at a Scratching Post in your den. At any time, you can equip up to four Skills. Trade them out when you are feeling like trying something new.///Some Skills provide additional utility, and others provide new fighting techniques to use in combat. You can spend experience points to level up an existing Skill and make it more powerful.///Every cat is different, and their Skills of choice play a large role in how they interact with the world around them. Spend some time finding out which skills you like best![/blue]///[purple]Focus is a wonderful asset in the paws of a capable cat. You can channel your focus to accomplish whatever you set your heart after.[/purple]
column2244: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about bugs today.///There are several types of docile bugs that live in the Wildwood. Beetles, butterflies, crickets, fireflies, and more can all be found here.///They are too self-absorbed to think of you as a threat, so they will not run away if you approach. However, they are too small to reliably pounce on from a great distance.///If you want to catch a bug, simply walk up to one and slash at it with your claws.///You can take it home to give away as a gift, to sell at a shop, or to collect for yourself. Some cats really appreciate being given certain types of bugs as gifts. Happy bug-catching to you![/blue]///[purple]Drown out thoughts of anger and of fear with thoughts of acceptance and love. It will become easier with each attempt.[/purple]
column2245: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about charging your attacks today.///To fight smart, make sure to create some distance between you and your enemy at all times. Stay out of reach of their claws.///Charge your attacks and launch into your enemy to deal additional damage and prevent them from quickly retaliating in kind. Then, move quickly out of the way while they recover.///There are three levels of charge: light, medium, and heavy. To slash with a light attack, simply tap the attack button and your claws will shine red.///You will swiftly lash out, dealing a small amount of damage and staying put where you are.///To perform a medium attack, hold the attack button for a second or two until a purple flame appears above your head.///Then, release to launch yourself forward a short distance and deal a moderate amount of damage.///Your best attack is a heavy attack, which you can perform by holding the attack button for several seconds until a blue flame appears above your head.///When you release the attack button, you will fly forward a great distance and do lots of damage to anything in your way.///While charging an attack, you can strafe from side to side without changing direction. Use this to your advantage to move further away from your opponents until you are ready to unleash your assault.///You can cancel a held charge at any time by dodging quickly out of the way.///Best of luck next time you get into a fight![/blue]///[purple]Be grateful for the abundance in your life. Not every cat is so fortunate as you.[/purple]
column2246: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about swimming today.///There are several large lakes and rivers in the area, and that means it is likely you will need to swim from time to time.///Most cats are able to stay afloat on their own for a short time without a problem, but it is unpleasant for many cats to get wet.///After treading water for a few seconds, you will notice your legs will begin to get tired and need a rest. When this happens, make your way to the nearest dry ground as quickly as possible.///If you stay in the water for too long, you may begin to drown!///If you are worried about crossing a large body of water, it may do you some good to collect some Thistle in advance.///Consuming this plant will increase your buoyancy and allow you to swim safely for a short time. Happy swimming![/blue]///[purple]You can be whoever you wish to become. There are no strings that hold you back. The only one who can define who you are is you.[/purple]
column2247: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about status effects today.///In certain environments, or as a reaction to some poisons, you may become saddled with a temporary status effect.///These are generally harmful states of being that can do a lot of damage to you, directly or indirectly.///The poison status effect will deal damage to you over time. It is generally acquired from the claws of venomous creatures, like adders and rats.///The slow status effect will impede your movements and make every action take longer for a period of time. It is generally acquired from specialized toxins.///The confusion status effect will addle your wits and reverse the signals in your brain, making you move in the opposite direction that you want to go. It is generally acquired from noxious gasses or toxic creatures.///These effects may be removed by consuming certain healing items, such as Coprinus mushrooms or Marigold flowers.///Alternatively, eating some Honeycomb will grant you immunity from all negative status effects for a short while.///Make sure you are prepared with the proper items on hand prior to experiencing any of these symptoms![/blue]///[purple]Your talents bring healing and blessings to all who encounter your work.[/purple]
column2248: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about dodging today.///You can also use your powerful legs to dodge out of harm's way at any time. Leap into the air where you will be invulnerable to attack for a precious few seconds.///Dodging can be performed in any one of eight directions: north, east, south, west, northeast, southeast, northwest, and southwest. You will always dodge in the direction you last moved.///Use a dodge if you see an enemy about to attack to avoid their claws. However, be careful!///When you land back on earth, you will need a little bit of time to regain your composure. During this short window of time, you are vulnerable to attack.///An expert fighter knows the right time to dodge to maximize its potential. Practice before you get into a serious fight to get the hang of dodging.[/blue]///[purple]Make time to celebrate your happiness.[/purple]
column2249: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about weather today.///Our local climate sees every type of weather, including sunny days, rain showers, blizzards, thunderstorms, fog, and more.///In general, precipitation will mean that there's less prey walking out and about.///Fog means that it is easier to sneak, but you may find it harder to notice threats lurking in the gloom as well.///Inclement weather such as thunderstorms and blizzards are nasty and unpleasant to be in, and very few animals will brave the weather during these events.///You can figure out what the weather will be in advance by consulting a Crystal Clear Pond.///Not only will you be given a vision of the current weather, but you will also be granted foresight into the weather pattern of tomorrow.///Use this weather-related knowledge to your advantage![/blue]///[purple]Awareness of one's own limitations is important for setting boundaries and avoiding unnecessary guilt.[/purple]
column2250: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about friendship today.///Have you made many good friends? If not, you can always grow a healthier relationship with any cat by making sure to talk to them regularly and bring them acceptable gifts.///A friend is a priceless asset. Not only will they have your back in tough times, but they will also try to make your life better.///On special days, they may even give you a present to show you how much they appreciate you.///Once you are really good friends with a cat, you can ask them to join you on your adventures. They will follow along and help you hunt, forage, and fight.///Eight paws are better than four in almost all circumstances![/blue]///[purple]You belong, and those around you care deeply about your life. Never forget that you are treasured and loved.[/purple]
column2251: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about colony management today.///By talking to Coco, you can administrate your colony. There are lots of customizable options to choose from to make your group special!///You can change the name of the colony, as well as your title. You also have control over what symbol you and the cats of your colony will use to identify yourselves.///There's tons to choose from, but the only right choice is the one you make yourself.[/blue]///[purple]Admiration, though often invisible, follows you everywhere you go.[/purple]
column2252: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about mining today.///While cats typically prefer to live above-ground, you may form an alliance with an industrious bunch of moles that dwell in a dark cavern.///They can be rude and cantankerous, but at the end of the day they're hard workers who will be happy to have your help.///Moles love brightly-colored gemstones, and diamonds most of all. You can use your claws to help the moles mine deeper and deeper into their cave and extract precious resources for their usage.///They will be sure to reward any cat who pitches in. Plus, moles are excellent teachers and will show you exactly how to mine.///Some say there are other treasures to be found lurking in the deep places of the world that are appealing to cats, but not to moles. Do you think you can find those, too?[/blue]///[purple]Your kindness is contagious. As it spreads to others, you make the world a kinder place.[/purple]
column2253: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you about changing your name today.///Sometimes, you grow tired of your existing name, or you outgrow it. That's OK! Every cat has a right to be called what they would like to be called.///That's why Elli maintains the paperwork for the colony's official identity documentation.///By speaking with Elli, you can change your old name into a new, exciting name at any time. If you can't think of any good ideas, Elli can also offer you several random options to pick from.///Choose something that really resonates with you, and all the cats of the colony will start calling you by your new name immediately.[/blue]///[purple]You must give yourself permission to do those things that are important to you. Do not let others decide what you can and cannot do.[/purple]
column2254: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about shops today.///As a business, some cats and other creatures have opened shops where they will sell you items in exchange for various currencies. They may also offer to buy your items in exchange for coins.///When browsing a shop, make sure you bring along plenty of currency. If an item is too expensive for you at the moment, there's no way you will convince the shopkeeper to sell it to you on the cheap.///To make some money, try selling any items you don't need. Be aware that some shopkeepers are not interested in certain items and will only purchase things that catch their eye.///When selling items, you can choose to sell each item individually, or choose the 'Sell All' option to offload all your qualifying items at once. It may save you some serious time and make you some serious cash![/blue]///[purple]Listen to your heart and do not be afraid of its wisdom. It is more valuable than you know.[/purple]
column2255: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about friendship today.///Having a couple good friends is an important part of any cat's life, and I'm going to show you how to do it!///When speaking to a cat, you may see a row of stars next to their portrait. Those stars indicate what level of friendship you have achieved with that cat.///The more stars that are present, the better a friend that cat considers you to be. The lowest star count you can have is 0, and the highest is 4.///By the time you've reached 4 stars, you will be very close friends.///You can increase your friendship rank, thus increasing how many stars appear under a cat's portrait, by talking to them daily and giving them gifts regularly.///Just make sure you don't accidentally give them something they will not like.[/blue]///[purple]Give yourself the care and affection that you deserve.[/purple]
column2256: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about your inventory today.///You are capable of carrying several items around at a time. When you do, these items are stored in your inventory. If you have more than one of any type of item, it will form a stack.///When you are just starting out, a stack has a maximum size of 3. However, you can purchase an Inventory Upgrade that will expand your potential and allow you to carry more than 3 items per stack.///Rumor has it that you can carry up to 9 items per stack once you have all the Inventory Upgrades unlocked. Wow, that's a lot of items!///When your inventory is getting full, you should return to town to store your items or sell off any excess items that you do not need.///It does you no good to explore and find new items that you cannot bring back home.[/blue]///[purple]Your actions benefit all those who are near.[/purple]
column2257: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about dreams today.///Sometimes, when turning in for the night, you will experience a strange vision in your sleep that takes the form of a dream.///Dreams can be happy, joyful, weird, or even scary.///Some cats believe that their dreams have a special meaning that can be unraveled through great thought and wisdom. Is this true, or is this just a theory? I'll let you be the judge of that.[/blue]///[purple]You are headed on the right course. Do not fear your destiny, but embrace it fully.[/purple]
column2258: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about the social panel today.///The social panel can be accessed through your inventory. It is updated every day to show which cats you have currently met and if you have spoken to them or given them a gift already today.///It will also show you your current standing with each cat individually, so you can see who you still need to befriend.///If you see a cake icon next to any cat's face, that means that today is their birthday! Make sure to stop by and say hello, and possibly bring a special birthday gift. They will surely appreciate it.///Use the social panel every day to keep track of your dealings with all cats of the colony.[/blue]///[purple]Be mindful of yourself as you grow to accept your own emotions. They are your inner guides that will not lead you astray.[/purple]
column2259: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about saving today.///When you have played for some time, you will surely want to save your progress so that you can pick up where you left off at a later time and safely close the game. Saving your progress regularly is a great idea!///The easiest way to save is to use a bed in your den. You will have the option to save there. I would advise saving once every day.///You may also choose to save your progress as you move through the world from just about anywhere, with a few key exceptions.///However, it is important to note that when you load your progress later, you will be teleported back to your den!///Keep these principles in mind to make sure that you do not lose your progress at any point. Save often![/blue]///[purple]You have many reasons to be proud of yourself.[/purple]
column2260: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about ranked herbs today.///Most herbs have a rank associated with them, denoted by stars (★, ★★, or ★★★). The rank of an herb will tell you how potent and valuable it is.///The higher the star rank, the better the quality of herb. ★★★ is the highest possible rank.///When foraging in the wilderness, you will only run across rank ★ and rank ★★ herbs. These are wild varieties that are good, but have not reached their full potential.///If you start an herb garden, you have the potential to grow rank ★★★ herbs! Treat your plants well and they will reward you by yielding a superior crop.///These special herbs are worth a lot of mews and are very powerful when consumed.[/blue]///[purple]Let your wandering mind rest easily in the knowledge that you are sufficient and whole.[/purple]
column2261: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about hunger today.///Ever feel that gnawing sensation when you are really, really hungry? Every cat experiences it from time to time. The best cure for hunger is a hearty meal!///You can eat some types of plants, but prey is the best option for satisfying the strongest of cravings.///You can see how hungry you are at any time by looking at your hunger meter, which looks like a long fish, in the lower-left hand corner of the screen.///When the fish is all filled up, you are full! Great, you've done an excellent job of caring for yourself. But if the fish is nearly empty or completely empty, it's time to eat!///Seek out a snack immediately to avoid negative consequences.///When you are starving, you will take damage over time until you eat something. It's never a good idea to let yourself go hungry for too long.///Some activities, like mining, will make you go hungry faster than you naturally would otherwise. It's a smart idea to always carry a little bit of food with you at all times, just in case.[/blue]///[purple]It is not selfish to spend time with yourself. Get to know the inner you.[/purple]
column2262: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about birthdays today.///Every cat likes to feel special from time to time! That's the greatest thing about a birthday. It gives a built-in day, once a year, when a cat can celebrate themself.///Check your calendar regularly so you don't miss out on a friend's birthday. They will seriously appreciate it if you take some time picking out a great gift and stop by to chat.///Who knows? Maybe on your birthday, they will return the favor and offer you a present.[/blue]///[purple]Greatness lies within you. You have the power to unlock it and share it with the world.[/purple]
column2263: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about tall grasses today.///Scattered throughout the world are some very overgrown patches of grasses. They grow like wildfire and cannot be kept down!///However, it may do you some good to cut these grasses. They are so thick that sometimes a passer-by will drop some coins and not notice that they lost their mews in the tall grass.///You may be able to collect these forgotten coins.///To clear out lots of grass at once, try charging up your attack and launching into a particularly dense patch of undergrowth. You can chop down lots of it at a time and maybe make a quick buck in the process![/blue]///[purple]You are a cat of high standing and great dignity.[/purple]
column2264: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about schedules today.///Schedules are the rhythm of life, and every cat has their own schedule that they keep to, more or less.///Based on a cat's particular preferences, they may prefer to spend their time at one of many different places.///If you are observant, you may be able to figure out where each colony cat likes to hang out and at what times. Having this knowledge will make it a whole lot easier to make sure you say hello each and every day.[/blue]///[purple]Let your dreams be your guiding light.[/purple]
column2265: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about tasks today.///A wise leader will erect a task board somewhere in town, a place where any cat can come and post a note about a job that needs doing, in exchange for a reward.///If you have a free day and want to try solving a problem for someone else, you should stop by the task board and review the available jobs.///You will not be penalized if you are unable to complete a task. There's no reason not to try your luck at completing a few!///It often makes sense to take on as many tasks as you can. You may complete one or two of them without even trying as you go about your day, and you'll net a bonus for finishing them!///Completed tasks reward task tokens, a specialized currency that can be exchanged for really special prizes. Collect lots of these tokens then cash them in for some exclusive rewards![/blue]///[purple]A generous spirit will win you many friends.[/purple]
column2266: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about black roses today.///Roses hold a deeply symbolic meaning in cat culture. A red rose, for example, is given to show romantic affection. A black rose, however, is a sign of disdain and hatred.///These withered plants have been neglected and gone unwatered for so long that some level of bitterness and decay has seeped into their very essence, and any cat can see it from a distance.///Giving a black rose to another cat is a sign of enmity between you and them, and there is absolutely no way that they will take it well.///Be very careful with a black rose. They are a great way to break things off or end a relationship that is in motion quickly.///If you aren't trying to make someone mad, don't show them a black rose under any circumstance![/blue]///[purple]Do not seek to control the things that you cannot manipulate. Let them slip through your mind like heavy weights so that you may focus on the things that matter.[/purple]
column2267: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about the news today.///Every day, Coco collects the relevant news and broadcasts it to the colony through a special reflection pool. You can view the news in your Crystal Clear Pond.///It is worthwhile to listen to the day's news every morning so that you will not miss out on any special events, such as festivals.///You will also get a heads-up anytime the season is about to change or if it is someone's birthday today.///Tune in every day so you can stay up to date with all the latest happenings![/blue]///[purple]The heart of a creative cat lives within you. Your actions are an art that beautifies the world.[/purple]
column2268: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about flowers today.///Flowers can be quite pretty, and make for great decorations or gifts. However, you should exhibit some caution around certain types of flowers.///Snake Lily, for example, is a poisonous flower that can be used to apply a deadly toxin to your claws.///Daisies are also dangerous, as consuming them will addle your wits and straddle you with confusion for a short time.///You can admire their beauty, but do so from a safe distance![/blue]///[purple]Have the courage to affirm yourself daily.[/purple]
column2269: [blue]Hello, [/blue]#player_name#[blue]. How are you? I'd like to tell you more about festivals today.///On special occasions, you will have the chance to attend a party, hosted by the cats of your colony. These wonderful, joyous days are called festivals by the cats of the Wildwood.///On a festival day, everybody will be in a great mood! Pay attention to the daily news to find out what time the festival starts and when it ends so you will not miss out on the fun.///You can win lots of awesome prizes by gaining festival tokens, a special currency that is only available by winning festival games. Make sure you participate so you can earn plenty of tokens.///If you don't spend your festival tokens, you can hold onto them for the next festival. Save up to buy something really great![/blue]///[purple]Be bold when you set your goals. Be firm when opposition arises. Be joyful when you overcome.[/purple]
column2271: [orange]THE GRAVE WE DIG#nl#Season 1, Episode 1: The Yawning Cave[/orange]///[gray]In a remote land far away, there dwells a society of moles with a hunger for gems.///Three moles, long-time friends, have banded together to create a mining company to extract precious stones from the earth and bring home a big, big profit...///There's [blue]MOLIR[/blue], the leader, the sharp mole who came up with the idea for this whole enterprise in the first place.///There's [red]MOZZ[/red], the fearless mole with a hunger for adventure and adrenaline.///And of course, there's [green]MEEP[/green], the littlest of moles, dragged along by the others.[/gray]///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Alright, gang, we've got our equipment and are all set to start mining! Mozz, did you remember to pack our rations? We're going to be out for quite a while, you know.///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Uh, yep! I packed a handful of grubs. Ought to make fer a good lunch. Besides, ain't there lots of crickets down there ta eat?///[green]MEEP[/green]: Oh, Mozz! That's hardly enough to go around. Did you only think of yourself when you were packing? We'll surely starve!///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Not to worry! I put some extra earthworms in my bag. Nothing will stop us! It's now or never. We've got to head into the mines today. You good to go, Meep?///[green]MEEP[/green]: Uhh... I don't really know about this. But I guess if you two are by my side, everything will be OK. Probably. Maybe.///[red]MOZZ[/red]: That's the spirit! Let's head inside.///[gray]The three mole-friends enter the dark cave and begin their descent. But what will they find in the dark places of the world? Tune in next time to find out![/gray]
column2272: [orange]THE GRAVE WE DIG#nl#Season 1, Episode 2: The First Test[/orange]///[gray]Somewhere beneath the earth, in a dimly-lit cave, a trio of courageous moles mines for priceless gems...[/gray]///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Hey, gang! This isn't so bad. This cave is much brighter than I expected, and there's rocks everywhere. I'm confident we'll find some valuable ore in no time.///[green]MEEP[/green]: Uh... yeah, it's really not so scary. I'm going to keep breaking up these boulders, yell if you find anything interesting.///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Oi! What's this? I think I've found something inside this 'ere stone... Errr, never mind. It's just a bunch o' debris. Nothin' fancy.///[gray]As their pickaxes continue to swing, the air gets thick with dust. Suddenly, a high-pitched shriek pierces the air![/gray]///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Hey, did you say something, Meep? I thought I heard someone shouting.///[green]MEEP[/green]: It wasn't me! It must have been...///[gray]A bat! The huge, red-eyed menace flies swiftly towards the moles, ready to strike.[/gray]///[green]MEEP[/green]: Ahhh! Somebody help me, it's diving right for my face!///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Never fear! I'll bring down the vermin! Oi, with one swing of my pick I'll have it on the ground!///[gray]And so the heroic Mozz saved the day, defeating the flying menace. But the fear from its presence still grips at poor Meep's heart.///What challenges lie ahead for our beloved moles? Tune in next time to find out![/gray]
column2273: [orange]THE GRAVE WE DIG#nl#Season 1, Episode 3: Breaking Up[/orange]///[gray]The gallant triple team of moles continues to mine deep in the heart of the earth. They have defeated their first foe, an evil flying bat.///But what other evils still lurk in the cave?[/gray]///[red]MOZZ[/red]: 'ey, I need some help over here! My pickaxe just broke! It shattered into a million pieces when I tried t' hit that big boulder!///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Oh no, that's no good. We can't make steady progress if we're down a mole. Let's see if we can patch it up. Any ideas, Meep?///[green]MEEP[/green]: Uh... I found some Iron Ore? It's not refined or anything like that, but maybe you could use that?///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: It's worth a shot. Here, Mozz, try mining with this Iron Ore.///[gray]Mozz takes the chunk of mineral and begins smashing it against a hard rock. Predictably, it does not work very well. Pebbles come flying off both surfaces as he strikes.[/gray]///[red]MOZZ[/red]: No good, Molir. What am I going to do now??///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Wait a second, Mozz. Why don't you just use your claws? They're big and good for digging, right? Isn't that what moles are made to do?///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Yer a genius, Molir. I don't know why I didn't think of that sooner.///[green]MEEP[/green]: Hooray! Problem solved! Can we continue now?///[gray]And so the band of mining moles continues digging downward. What will happen next? Tune in next time to find out![/gray]
column2274: [orange]THE GRAVE WE DIG#nl#Season 1, Episode 4: The Stairs of Woe[/orange]///[gray]Molir, Mozz, and Meep, three brave moles, have been digging for quite a while. They have not yet found any gems, but they must be getting close...[/gray]///[green]MEEP[/green]: Hey, where are all the riches we were supposed to find? I haven't seen a single shiny pebble, let alone a Diamond!///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Now now, gang, we need to have patience. This industry isn't for the faint of heart. If we stick to our schedule, we should be deep enough to find gemstones in no time.///[red]MOZZ[/red]: According to my nose, we must be getting close. It's got that pretty-scent, oi.///[green]MEEP[/green]: Hey, guys! I found a staircase down. But it looks so dark! I can't see the bottom at all! I don't like the look of that one bit. Maybe we should turn around.///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Hmmm... Meep, you may be right. Maybe we can find another way down instead?///[gray]Just then, a terrifying noise of many beating wings starts rumbling in the distance. Suddenly, a huge swarm of bats descends upon the moles![/gray]///[green]MEEP[/green]: Oh no! One bat was bad enough. Now there's like, a hundred of them!! What are we gonna do??///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Keep your heads, gang! We've got to hide! Quick, hurry down the staircase! Maybe they won't notice.///[gray]The moles descend the dark passage, into the gloom that awaits below. What will become of the moles in the shadows of the mine? Tune in next week to find out![/gray]
column2275: [orange]THE GRAVE WE DIG#nl#Season 1, Episode 5: A Flickering Flame[/orange]///[gray]Three moles stumble in the dark beneath the earth. It is pitch-black, and nothing can be seen but the dim reflections of a distant light against their tiny, black eyes.[/gray]///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Well, we avoided the bat swarm. But now we're stuck in this unbearably dim cave. I wish we would have brought something along to help us see.///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Let's brainstorm together, gang. What can we do about the dark?///[green]MEEP[/green]: We could cry.///[red]MOZZ[/red]: We could just keep digging, and let our noses be our guide.///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: We could head back up to the surface and buy a light source of some kind.///[gray]What's that? In the vague shadows of the far end of the cave, a flame can be seen hovering in midair...[/gray]///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Or we could head over to that fire! Maybe it's an old mining lantern, still burning with oil?///[gray]The three moles approach, and the light oscillates between a brilliant green fire and a sickly pale flicker.[/gray]///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Oi, Molir! That's no lantern... That's a Darkcandle! Nasty vermin they are. It'll hunt us down and shoot at us if we don't keep our distance!///[green]MEEP[/green]: Too late! It's coming this way! What are we gonna do?///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Mozz, you distract it! I'll hide behind that boulder there. When it passes by, it'll be lights out for the Darkcandle.///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Great plan, boss! Oi, Darkcandle! Come and get me!///[gray]And so the threat of the Darkcandle was dealt with by our intrepid adventuring moles. But they are still shrouded in utter darkness. How can they go on? Tune in next week to find out![/gray]
column2276: [orange]THE GRAVE WE DIG#nl#Season 1, Episode 6: Light[/orange]///[gray]In the gloom of a pitch-black cavern, three mole friends band together and look for a way to press on...[/gray]///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Hey, gang! Look what I just stumbled across. It's a Headlamp!///[green]MEEP[/green]: Do you think it still has any charge left on the batteries? There's no way that works.///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Only one way t' find out. Lemme see that.///[gray]With the click of a button, the Headlamp brilliantly flares to life with a bright, illuminating beam![/gray]///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Heh, look at that! Now we've got light. We can keep mining, gang!///[green]MEEP[/green]: Can I carry it? I'm scared...///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Of course, Meep. You can be our eyes. Look for staircases that lead further down!///[green]MEEP[/green]: Oh, there's one right over there. We must have just passed by and missed it stumbling around in the dark.///[gray]And so the trio descends once more, further into the earth. They still have not found any precious gems! What will become of our heroic moles? Tune in next week to find out![/gray]
column2277: [orange]THE GRAVE WE DIG#nl#Season 1, Episode 7: Dreams and Ruin[/orange]///[gray]When we last left Molir, Mozz, and Meep, the three moles were in a jolly good mood. They found a Headlamp to help them see in the dark and continued their descent into the mines in search of gems...///[red]MOZZ[/red]: 'ey, what's that shiny crystal pokin' out of that there boulder? Do ya think it's valuable?///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: That's Quartz, Mozz! Great eye. If we can collect some Quartz, we'll be sure to be rich moles in no time.///[green]MEEP[/green]: I like the sound of that! Let's get digging.///[gray]The trio quickly mines all the Quartz from the surrounding rocks. It's very heavy, but nothing could dim their spirits. Well, almost nothing...[/gray]///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Hey, gang. What do you think you're going to do with all that Mole Cash when we finally cash in?///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Oi, that's an easy question! I was gonna buy me a big workshop where I can make swords and picks and all sorts of nice things. Moles will come from far an' wide ta see my shop!///[green]MEEP[/green]: I hadn't really thought about it. Probably save up and enough to go back to school and switch careers. I don't like it down here one bit.///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: I'm going to buy a big underground mansion with a gold-plated entryway. It's going to be awesome!///[gray]But their plans have to wait. Because soon, a thunderous noise begins to shake the cavern![/gray]///[green]MEEP[/green]: Ahh! I don't know what's happening but I don't like it!///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: It's a cave-in! Everybody, find something strong to hide underneath!///[gray]When the dust settles, the moles emerge. The stairs above them are coated in thick debris and are cracked and ruined. What will become of our beloved moles? Tune in next week to find out![/gray]
column2278: [orange]THE GRAVE WE DIG#nl#Season 1, Episode 8: Decisions (Season Finale!)[/orange]///[gray]When we last left our beloved trio of moles, a deadly cave-in cut off their route back up to the surface, leaving them trapped in the dark depths of the earth...[/gray]///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: All that talk about riches and rewards, and now we're stuck! This is no good. We need to come up with a plan.///[green]MEEP[/green]: I knew this would happen! I knew I shouldn't have come down here! I'm never listening to you two ever again.///[red]MOZZ[/red]: Won't need to make that promise if we never make it out of here, Meep.///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Mozz is right. What can we do?///[red]MOZZ[/red]: I vote we keep digging. Maybe we'll find another path up if we keep going down.///[green]MEEP[/green]: That's the stupidest idea I've ever heard. You want to go up by going down?///[red]MOZZ[/red]: You got a better idea?///[green]MEEP[/green]: ...///[blue]MOLIR[/blue]: Alright, it's settled then. We'll keep digging down and hope to discover another route to the surface as we dig.///[gray]Will our moles ever make it out? Will there be more dangers along the way? Tune in to Season 2 to find out![/gray]
column2279: Welcome back to [green]GREEN PAW[/green]. I'm your host, Violet Catsworth. In today's episode, we'll take a look at Spring plants and how to make the most of them.///In the springtime, constant rainshowers bring lots of moisture to the area. Great news for plants! You will find an abundance of nearly every kind of flowering herb growing on just about every grassy hill.///Flowers showcase their beauty as they dance in the gentle breeze. In particular, you will find Daisies, beautiful white flowers with bright yellow centers.///While it's OK to look, you might want to keep your distance from a Daisy. These gorgeous blooms are notoriously poisonous to cats if ingested.///You will also find delicious Raspberries growing on low-hanging bushes. They're a cheery red color. If you get hungry on a walk, you can pick a few and pop them in your mouth. Yum!///Another edible plant that grows in the springtime is Licorice. Some cats find it's an acquired taste, but this earthy, bitter plant can make a long walk more bearable if you chew on its roots.///I've been your host, Violet Catsworth. I'll return next season with more foraging advice. Ta ta for now!
column2280: Welcome back to [green]GREEN PAW[/green]. I'm your host, Violet Catsworth. In today's episode, we'll take a look at Summer plants and how to make the most of them.///The temperature is warm and the rain is not so constant in the summer, but an afternoon thunderstorm can still bring much-needed nourishment to many of the herbs that grow in the wild.///One plant to keep an eye out for is Foxglove, a gorgeous pink plant with several bell-shaped blossoms. Foxglove flowers are exceptionally rare, but well worth harvesting!///When applied to the claws, the Foxglove plant will make your attacks stronger due to its poisonous nature. One cat can strike with the strength of two!///You will also still find Raspberries and Licorice sprouting here and there, but these two plants are on their way out. Harvest them now if you want to keep some for the rest of the year. They will soon go dormant.///I've been your host, Violet Catsworth. I'll return next season with more foraging advice. Ta ta for now!
column2281: Welcome back to [green]GREEN PAW[/green]. I'm your host, Violet Catsworth. In today's episode, we'll take a look at Autumn plants and how to make the most of them.///Everything is cooling down, and several species of flora are already starting to go dormant. The trees are turning brown as they begin to drop their leaves in preparation for the cold days ahead.///However, a savvy cat can still find a wealth of herbs growing on the ground, if they know where to look!///Autumn is the only time of year to forage for Mushrooms, which come in several varieties.///These potent fungi can be used in a myriad of ways. For example, White Button and Portobello are good for eating, whereas Coprinus can be used to treat poison.///If you come across a small, white-speckled mushroom with a red top, think twice before eating! These mushrooms, called Amanita, have unpredictable effects.///You will also find Blackberries, delicious dark purple treats, growing wild. Snake Lily, a toxic plant used to apply a poison effect to your claws, has also begun to grow, especially in the swampy regions of the Wildwood.///Lastly, I'd advise you to stock up on some healing herbs. Both Goldenseal and Marigold are about to go dormant for the year, and you won't be able to find these valuable herbs in the wintertime.///I've been your host, Violet Catsworth. I'll return next season with more foraging advice. Ta ta for now!
column2282: Welcome back to [green]GREEN PAW[/green]. I'm your host, Violet Catsworth. In today's episode, we'll take a look at Winter plants and how to make the most of them.///Now that the snow has arrived, you won't find many herbs growing in the wild! Most plants have withered up or gone dormant by now.///However, you may still stumble across a special few plants that are worth your time to collect.///Blueberries are uniquely suited to grow during the winter months. It's not hard to see them from a distance by their vibrant blue color, which contrasts sharply with the white snow.///Also, winter is a good month to collect Snake Lily. It will stop growing as soon as the weather starts to warm up again, so make a couple trips to the wetlands if you want to stock up.///Peppermint can also be found during winter. This soft, leafy herb has a very strong scent. You can apply it to your coat to mask your natural cat odor. By doing so, you may have an easier time sneaking up on prey.///If you find yourself out after dark, winter is an especially good time to hunt for the elusive Queen of the Night, a beautiful blossom that only blooms after dark. It has snow-white petals, making it difficult to track down.///I've been your host, Violet Catsworth. I hope you have learned something today. Ta ta for now!
column2283: A warm home is an inviting place to relax. From bright, open floorplans to cozy, casual rooms, every den is unique and needs time and care to meet its full potential. You're watching [yellow]GOOD DENKEEPING[/yellow].///If you're looking to create the perfect space for entertaining, you'll need to keep an open mind when it comes to buying furniture.///There's so many different styles to choose from! How do you know which to use?///Renowned home decorator Claws Puffington has this to say: 'Go with your gut! Your den should be a celebration of who you are, not who everybody else is. Pick furniture that speaks to you.'///To get a fresh, clean look, make sure your home is full of light. You can install several points of light, such as lamps or windows, in strategic places throughout your home.///The Firefly Jar furniture piece is a great starting point for lightening up a dark corner.///Remember, some light is warm and some light is cold. Each type will create a different mood in the space it illuminates. Go for warm light for a cozy, tight space, like a bedroom or a storage cellar.///Once you own a piece of furniture, you can really start to get creative! You can place down as many copies of that furniture as you'd like, without additional costs or restrictions.///The only limiting factor is how much space you have to work with!///If you need new furniture to spruce up your home, then it's time to go shopping. Visit the colony store or festival shops to purchase additional pieces. A new item can change the whole vibe of a room.///Keep these helpful tips and tricks in mind next time you want to redecorate your den!
column2284: A warm home is an inviting place to relax. From bright, open floorplans to cozy, casual rooms, every den is unique and needs time and care to meet its full potential. You're watching [yellow]GOOD DENKEEPING[/yellow].///Feeling cramped in your current space? How does an upgrade sound? You can add a little square footage to an existing den with the help of your friendly neighborhood contractor mole!///To renovate your home, call for Molby. With the help of some blueprint paper, you can plan out exactly what size and shape you imagine your dream den to be.///However, renovation isn't cheap! Make sure you've saved your Mews before you start the process.///You can also switch up the style of your walls and floors while you're at it. Fortunately for you, this part of the design process is totally free.///Some flooring types, like Ice and Sand, have special properties. Experiment a bit with different styles until you're happy with the result.///Keep these helpful tips and tricks in mind next time you need to freshen up your floorplan!
column2285: A warm home is an inviting place to relax. From bright, open floorplans to cozy, casual rooms, every den is unique and needs time and care to meet its full potential. You're watching [yellow]GOOD DENKEEPING[/yellow].///A smart cat knows how to squeeze all the functionality out of any space. To do so, they'll intelligently lay out their floorplan with several special furniture items to meet their needs.///A BED, for example, is almost a necessity. You can use a bed to sleep, obviously.///You'll also want to place some sort of STORAGE device, like a Storage Crate, to hold all your stuff. While you can just throw your items on the ground, it can get a tad messy doing things that way.///If you want the clutter out of the way, opt to use a STORAGE furniture piece instead.///It's also a great idea to hang a CALENDAR somewhere in your house so that you can get an idea of what events are happening soon.///Of course, you'll want some sort of viewing device, like a CRYSTAL CLEAR POND. But you already knew that.///Lastly, make room for a SCRATCHING POST if you want to train your skills from the comfort of your own home. It'll keep you healthy!///Keep these tips and tricks in mind as you lay out your den!
column2286: A warm home is an inviting place to relax. From bright, open floorplans to cozy, casual rooms, every den is unique and needs time and care to meet its full potential. You're watching [yellow]GOOD DENKEEPING[/yellow].///Let's talk all about Storage! To preserve a pristine place of residence, it's really important that you keep your hallways clear of clutter.///What to do with all those extra items? Chuck them into a Storage Crate, or other storage apparatus!///Don't worry, you can hide a lot of items in one of these incredible devices. I've heard they can hold over 175,000 items at a time! Wowza!///To use a Storage furniture item, walk up to it and interact with it. That'll bring up the Storage panel, where you can see everything you have in your inventory and also what's currently being stored.///By selecting an item in your inventory, you can move it to your storage instantly. You can also choose to store everything you're holding all at once.///And of course, you can try to retrieve your entire storage all at once, too. However, if you're storing a ton of items, you may find that you can't carry all that stuff at the same time!///Keep these tips and tricks in mind next time you want to declutter and organize your room!
column2287: We now return to [blue]TALL TAILS[/blue], brought to you by the Public Cat Broadcasting Committee. We are thankful for our sponsors and donations from cats like you, who help keep [blue]TALL TAILS[/blue] on the air.///Have you ever watched a ladybug? Graceful critters, they glide through the air as though nothing could ever bother them.///Their radiantly colored shells, dotted with so many spots, shine like paintings against the canvas-like flowers of the meadows.///Of course, ladybugs are known for their great variety. Brilliant shades of red, of yellow, and of black are common sights in the springtime.///But what if I told you that some cats believe there is another type of ladybug, one that has been around since the beginning, but which is rarely seen by feline eyes?///Yes, it's true! Of all the myths and legends that have been passed down from generation to generation, none is more well-known than the story of the Blue Ladybug.///According to tradition, the first ladybugs were all blue, you see. Blue as the sky on a warm summer day. Blue as the depths of the deepest lake. Blue as blue paint, minus the black spots, of course.///And why were they blue, you might ask? It's an odd color for a bug to be. Well, if you believe the old tales, the ladybugs were citizens of a lofty city in the skies, nestled among the clouds.///They used their blue shells as a natural form of camouflage, and they painted their city the same bright blue pigment to keep it secret and unnoticed by the ground-dwelling animals like you and me.///However, some of the ladybugs of the cloud-city became old and fragile, and they slowly drifted down to earth. In their weakened state, they were not strong enough to fly back up to the city of their people.///Others believe that there was a civil war amongst the ladybugs of the clouds, and the members of the losing faction were stripped of their stronger sky-gliding wings and cast down from the skies.///And thus, they became stuck here, destined to live near the ground for all time.///As the long years passed, their brilliant blue garments began to fade to other strange colors. Reds and yellows and near-black grays.///What an absurd story! I certainly have never seen a Blue Ladybug in all my years of studying the creatures.///And now we close the book on the tale of the Blue Ladybug. Come back next season to hear me tell another strange story.
column2288: We now return to [blue]TALL TAILS[/blue], brought to you by the Public Cat Broadcasting Committee. We are thankful for our sponsors and donations from cats like you, who help keep [blue]TALL TAILS[/blue] on the air.///Have you ever thought how strange it is that cats like you and me are able to withstand all the elements of nature and continue to live fruitful lives?///We have many reasons to be grateful! Not the least of those reasons are the Guardian Spirits.///Benevolent mystical beings, the Guardians are incalculably strong and usually quite wise. They have been friends to the cats for longer than memory can recall.///It seems that each Guardian Spirit has found a large group of cats to adopt and protect and nurture. With the blessing of a Guardian being, we stay healthy and strong for longer than nature should allow.///Aside from the threats that the natural realm can pose, the Guardians spend their days protecting us from all sorts of unseen threats that only their shrewd eyes can perceive.///I once asked a powerful Guardian to describe them to me, but they fell silent and would not answer my request.///And now we close the book on the tale of the Guardian Spirits. Come back next season to hear me tell another strange story.
column2289: We now return to [blue]TALL TAILS[/blue], brought to you by the Public Cat Broadcasting Committee. We are thankful for our sponsors and donations from cats like you, who help keep [blue]TALL TAILS[/blue] on the air.///Have you ever heard the Tale of the First Rain? According to legend, there once lived two twin cats who were so alike in both appearance and temperament that no cat could truly tell them apart.///These twin cats were great lovers of growing things, and they kept a large garden full of every type of flowering plant.///It was beautiful to behold and wondrous were the scents that lingered long in that fair valley.///Each morning, the twins would depart from their beloved garden and travel far to the shores of a freshwater lake to collect water for their plants.///One day, while journeying to the lake, they stumbled across an extraordinary flower. Its petals danced and shimmered with every color imaginable. It was the most beautiful flower they had ever seen!///Naturally, they felt they must bring it back home and plant it in their garden. So they used their claws to carefully dig up the roots. They took turns carrying the delicate blossom on the trip home.///However, by the time they arrived, the poor flower had withered and decayed to a deathly brown twig, a mere shadow of its former glory.///The twins greatly mourned the loss of such a profoundly beautiful flower. They refused to leave its side, hoping that with their love and care the flower would once again bloom. For many days this continued.///They did so at the expense of all their other plants. Without water, the garden began to shrivel and die. All the cats of the world were saddened by the fading of such a once-gorgeous place.///As the days wore on, the twins became slower and slower as they went about their chores, because they realized that their beautiful flower would not return to them.///They became like stone, and sat with mourning faces turned upward in hopeless desperation. Never again did they move from that spot. Legend has it that they still sit like silent stone watchers to this very day.///Even the powerful Guardian Spirits were moved by the tragic loss of both the twin cats and their beloved garden, and they began to weep. As they did so, the first rain began to fall from the sky!///As the water touched the hungry earth, the garden of the twins began to once again grow and spring to life!///A healthy green color returned to the leaves of the herbs, and everything flourished in the sudden downpour from the heavens.///But the twin cats did not return. And still the Guardians honor their memory by sending rain showers to the earth, watering the crops of the world in solemn remembrance for what was lost.///And now we close the book on the tale of the First Rain. Come back next season to hear me tell another strange story.
column2290: We now return to [blue]TALL TAILS[/blue], brought to you by the Public Cat Broadcasting Committee. We are thankful for our sponsors and donations from cats like you, who help keep [blue]TALL TAILS[/blue] on the air.///Have you ever met a mole? Odd creatures they are, living deep underground and digging endlessly for gems and riches to extract from the earth.///But why do they dig? And why must they find precious gems? I hope to shed some light on their strange situation in today's episode.///Of course, moles are practical creatures, and they need several types of ore to keep their industry afloat. Iron Ore is particularly useful to an industrious mole, because they need it to make new pickaxes.///But what about gemstones? What is it that attracts a mole to an emerald or quartz, or even a diamond?///Well, this part of the equation is not so simple! You see, some moles are connoisseurs of delectable sparkling minerals. Yes, as absurd as it sounds, some moles like to eat the jewels of the earth!///Others, perhaps those with softer teeth, are of the superstitious type.///Some moles have adopted the strange belief that these brilliantly-colored rocks have supernatural properties that can ward off evil spirits and prevent mishaps and misfortunes.///I suppose the moral of today's story is that every mole is different, much like cats. However, while their purposes are diverse, one thing can be said for certain: most moles love the sight of a rare gem!///And now we close the book on the tale of the moles and their minerals. Come back next season to hear me tell another strange story.
column2291: [green]Jupiter Mission#nl#Chapter 1[/green]///It's cold and dark inside the space station where I work. I look out the window and see Jupiter below, the enormous gas giant filling the entire viewport.///It glows with a harsh, red hue that fills the entire station. I hate that color. Keeps me awake.///But I chose this life. All the training I went through to get here. All the tests and the challenges I had to overcome to get this seat on this space station.///I'm lucky, really. Not everybody gets to do what I do. Somebody would love to switch places with me.///Honestly, I might take them up on that offer. I've been out here, all by myself, for over three months now.///Nobody to talk to but the station computer that rarely receives any transmissions. It takes months to communicate with earth.///It's not that I dislike my job, it's just that Jupiter is really, really far away. Far away from someone I care about. It sounds so sad to write, but I'm really missing Ganymede right now.///Not a day goes by that I don't think about him. Those warm locks of hair, that smile that disarms me in an instant. I wish he were up here with me.///But he chose a different path in life. I have to come to terms with that fact. It doesn't make me miss him any less...///TO BE CONTINUED
column2292: [green]Jupiter Mission#nl#Chapter 2[/green]///As we orbit the gas giant Jupiter, I take a glance out the window. Yep, still in space. Still millions of miles away from earth and everyone I care about. Still way too far from my beloved Ganymede.///A shrill beep sounds off every ten seconds. It's the life support systems, screaming out for attention.///It's a regular check-up, nothing to be concerned about. I just have to clean the vents and make sure all the wires are still attached. Yep, they're all still in place.///I press the button to indicate I've performed the necessary maintenance and now everything is silent again. Well, everything except my head.///Thoughts of home come screaming into my brain and drown out the silence quickly.///I remember being a kid, darting around the cul-de-sac on my bike, no cares in the world except school the next day.///I'd pedal on over to the canary-yellow house on the end of the street and walk right up to the big wood door. I'd knock three times and it would open. Ganymede, handsome even then, would answer.///We would take the whole afternoon to run around in the meadow by my parents' house. I'd pick a couple dandelions and twist them into a crown to give to him. He'd put it on his head and laugh.///That bright, wholesome laugh. It still gives me shivers just thinking about it.///Does he even know how I feel about him? Probably not. I imagine he watched with pride when news of my mission's departure was sweeping the headlines. I'd imagine he's down there, somewhere, rooting for me.///But does he love me like I love him? The thought tortures me. When I get back to earth, I know exactly what I'm going to do. First thing. If only there weren't so many long days in space still ahead...///TO BE CONTINUED
column2293: [green]Jupiter Mission#nl#Chapter 3[/green]///I awoke this morning to the sound of an alarm bell ringing. Not the regular-maintenance kind, but the 'hey, you're in deep trouble' kind.///An ear-piercing, heart-rending sort of alarm that sends chills into every bone of your body. I sprung out of my bed pod and got to work.///When there's nobody but you around, you have to do whatever jobs need doing, and fast. And when you're millions of miles away from earth, hurtling around an alien planet, you can't exactly call for backup.///I went to the command center and saw a bright red blip lighting up the radar monitor, blinking rapidly. Uh-oh. That's no good.///Something is heading towards the space station, and I don't know if I can stop it. It's probably a meteorite. If it slams into a window, who knows if the station will survive the impact.///Worse yet, maybe it'll take us off course completely, and I'll slowly spin out of control and spiral down into Jupiter and crash. Neither is a pretty scenario.///Well, I don't know if there's anything I can do about it. It does me no good to panic. I've got to keep a level head and try to think clearly.///I reach out in my thoughts to anything that can give me a little peace... And I quickly find something that makes me feel at ease.///I think about Ganymede, the man I left behind when I came here to space. Not my man, not yet. But I can dream, can't I?///I daydream about the life we could have, if only I were back on earth and told him how I feel. He'd tell me he feels the same, I'm sure of it. We'd get married and buy a house, somewhere in the suburbs.///Wouldn't that be nice? Don't I deserve happiness, after all I've done for humanity?///I snap back to. No, that's not reality. Not now. Not this moment. Maybe it will be that way, and maybe not. There's no way of knowing for sure.///Oh, wouldn't you know it! The radar just stopped screaming. Looks like that meteorite barely missed us. That's a relief!///I look out the huge viewport window and see it pass by the station at a safe distance. It's kind of beautiful, in its own way.///Well, now that the danger is gone, I'd better get back to my daily routine. If only I had someone else here, the days would pass much quicker...///TO BE CONTINUED
column2294: [green]Jupiter Mission#nl#Chapter 4[/green]///Astronaut food is nothing to write home about. As I sit at the small dining table at the rear of the space station, I munch on a packet of nutrients.///The label says beef stew, but I have my doubts. Whatever it is, it's hearty enough to keep me going, but the texture could definitely be better. I wish I could dig into some real food right now.///I can't help but think of the time that I was sick and Ganymede made me some homemade beef stew and brought it over to my place.///He told me it was just something he threw together, nothing special, but he was wrong.///It was the tastiest, most delicious stew I'd ever had. Warm and nice-smelling, like him. Not only is he ridiculously handsome, but he's also a great cook? Come on, what's not to love?///And I do love him. I've had a lot of time to sort out my feelings, being up here in space all alone. I never knew this is what love would feel like when I was back on earth. I've grown a lot since then.///Now I know for sure. This is love. I love Ganymede. I just have to find the time to tell him...///TO BE CONTINUED
column2295: [green]Jupiter Mission#nl#Chapter 5[/green]///My heart is racing. The computer just made a funny little noise, a blip sort of a sound, and I know what that means. It means a transmission is being received.///I float my way down the long, metal hallway that connects my bed pod to the command center.///As I enter the machine-filled room, I take a quick glance out the window. Yep, Jupiter is still below me. And I'm still all alone in space. I haven't heard from anyone in weeks.///I check the monitor. 'Receiving transmission. Download in progress. 1%...' My heart drops. It'll take forever for the message to come through!///And who might it be from? Is there any chance it's from... No, I can't let myself think that way. I'll just end up torturing myself, surely I'll be let down.///But the thought keeps resurfacing. Ganymede? Did you send me a message? Are you feeling the same way that I'm feeling, and you couldn't let anything, not even four hundred million miles, get in the way?///I take another look at the monitor. 50%. The suspense is crushing me. Maybe I should go do something else while I wait?///75%. Come on, Ganymede. What I would do to hear from you. It could be anything, even a super boring rant about how you got rained on coming home from the grocery store. I'd soak up every word, I promise.///100%! Download complete! Oh, stop beating so fast, heart. It's not that big of a deal. You can handle it. And...///It's from the Commander. I can see his stupid gray mustache filling the screen. I can't stand him.///He's overpaid for what he does. Not even willing to risk his own life and leave his precious earth behind. Sends me up here all alone instead.///His grating, irritating voice begins to play on the speakers. Something about needing a new reading from the gas sensors. Lack of data, yadda yadda yadda. In fairness, I forget to submit a report yesterday.///Well, now I'm bummed. Will I ever hear from my beloved Ganymede?///TO BE CONTINUED
column2296: [green]Jupiter Mission#nl#Chapter 6[/green]///As I lie in my bed pod, all is dark. I've shut the window blinds that keep the red glow from Jupiter from filling the station. It's time I get some much-needed sleep.///But my mind won't turn off. It's like I can't find the switch that says 'pipe down up there, I'm trying to sleep'. Memories of the academy are flooding in.///My instructors kept me on my toes. They knew I had what it took to become an astronaut. They weren't going to let me off easy, either. Those tests were so hard, but I aced them all.///I had so hoped that my childhood friend Ganymede would join me at space academy. He always wanted to be an astronaut growing up, but something changed in him around high school.///He started playing guitar. Now music was his life. He had the most angelic voice...///What I would do to hear him sing to me right now! I'll bet I could fall asleep real fast to the sound of a soft song.///Tomorrow, I'm going to do something about my feelings. I'm going to finally tell him how I feel. It's time.///TO BE CONTINUED
column2297: [green]Jupiter Mission#nl#Chapter 7[/green]///No more wasting time. No more playing games. It's time that I tell Ganymede how I truly feel.///I awaken from my bed pod and float through the space station with determination. I make my way to the computer and open up the messaging program. It's time that I put words to my emotions.///Of course, after I'm done it'll take at least a month for the transmission to reach earth. And then another month, minimum, to receive a reply. Can I stand to not hear back for so long?///Yes, it's worth it. I need to do this. I'm going to drive myself crazy if I don't. I start typing.///[gray]'Dear Ganymede, how are you? I really like you. I hope you feel the same.'[/gray]///No, no no, that's not right at all. It does nothing to express the sheer strength of my feelings. I have to win him over! I slam the delete key until everything disappears.///And then, I stare blankly at the screen. How can I possibly compose something that will do justice to my love? No words seem adequate.///And besides that, is this even fair? I'm stuck up here, in space, for quite some time. Months. Years, maybe. I may never even make it home. These space missions can be dangerous, after all.///No. I can't do that to my beloved Ganymede. It wouldn't be right to play on his heartstrings. It would be cruel of me to send any message...///TO BE CONTINUED
column2298: [green]Jupiter Mission#nl#Chapter 8[/green]///Another day, another beeping sensor. This time, it's an external module on the space station. The command center computer says it went offline sometime in the night.///Well, I'm up here alone, orbiting the gas giant Jupiter with nothing to rely on but the machinery of the station. So I'd better be a good tenant and go fix the broken module.///It probably just came unplugged or something.///I suit up in my space suit and float over to the airlock. I connect a thick tethering cable to my torso so I won't float away when all the air gets sucked out of the vestibule. And I hit the OPEN button.///Now I'm drifting outward into the black abyss of space. I use my arms to tug on the cable and propel myself toward the surface of the space station. I'll have to walk along the exterior to get to the busted sensor.///As I go about my task, I can't help but ponder how my entire life is in the hands of the white tether holding me to the metal of the space station.///If it were to snap for any reason, I'd be stuck in the vast expanse of outer space, unable to call for help. I'd drift for some time before I met my inevitable demise.///At times, it feels like my emotions have a tether of their own. Ganymede. My beloved. Holding my heart to my body and keeping me afloat in the cosmos of the mind.///What an odd thought. I find the sensor and jam it back into its port. The blue lights indicate it is once again working properly. Time to head back inside...///TO BE CONTINUED
column2299: [red]~Kitten Detective~#nl#Part 1: Whiskerpolis in Trouble[/red]///It's not easy living in Whiskerpolis. There are dangers around every corner, and the constant crimes are only one small part of that. That's why I became a detective, to help make things better.///I'm the youngest private detective in the city, and I've yet to cut my teeth on any big cases.///Sure, I've tracked down a missing pet turtle for an elderly couple and solved the mystery of why the water in the park fountain had that terrible odor, but none of those cases are going to make the news.///I need to land something big. Whiskerpolis is a city full of secrets. As I sit in my office, I stare down my collection of cold case folders and files.///These are mysteries the police department deemed unsolvable, but I'm convinced if I spend enough time pushing, something's bound to move. Eventually.///Every surface in the office is cluttered with papers, photos, and sketches from a dozen different cases.///Maybe if I were a more organized detective, I'd have one of those red-string-and-thumbtack corkboards that you see in the movies. Not me.///My concentration is shattered by a sudden noise. It's loud, and I jolt up from my slouched position. The phone is ringing. That's odd, nobody has ever called me before. I wonder who it is?///Whatever awaits me on the other end of the line, I get the feeling that my life will forever be changed...///To be continued!
column2300: [red]~Kitten Detective~#nl#Part 2: Empty Vaults[/red]///It was a normal Tuesday evening. I was sitting in my office, staring down cold case files, trying to make sense of the chaos contained within. Suddenly, the phone rang.///I picked up the receiver. 'Hello?' I said, trying to sound older and more trustworthy. When you're such a young, unexperienced detective like me, you have to project an air of confidence.///[gray]'Hello, is this the Kitten Detective? This is Mayor Mittens. Oh, it's just terrible! Just terrible!'[/gray] The voice on the other end is clearly distressed.///I wonder what may have happened that the mayor would call someone like me? 'Yes, Mayor, I'm the Kitten Detective. Is there a case that you need solved? I'll get to the bottom of it, I promise.'///A little bit of showboating goes a long way in landing a case. I'm not nearly as self-assured as my words indicate, but I have to try my best to get the job.///[gray]'Oh, good. When I looked up private detectives in the phone book, I saw your name first so I figured I'd give you a call.'[/gray] Well, that explains a lot.///[gray]'It's the National Catnip Bank. They've been robbed! Their vaults are completely emptied out. There's no catnip left. The city is financially ruined unless you can track it down!'[/gray]///'Not to worry, Mayor. I can handle it. Leave it to me, and I'll have this case closed in no time.' Again, I have no idea what I'm doing, but the less the Mayor knows, the better.///[gray]'Oh, that's just wonderful to hear! I'm putting my trust in your paws, Kitten Detective. Make your city proud.'[/gray] I hear a click on the other end. The Mayor must have hung up.///A burglary at the National Catnip Bank... This will be an interesting case, and I can hardly wait to start tracking down the culprit...///To be continued!
column2301: [red]~Kitten Detective~#nl#Part 3: No Evidence[/red]///Yesterday afternoon, I received a call from the Mayor of Whiskerpolis. He told me that the National Catnip Bank was robbed, bringing the city to its knees.///He's putting his trust in me, the Kitten Detective, to save the day. Which is a lot of pressure for a young, unexperienced detective like myself. I can't mess this one up!///I need to collect some data. I decide to head down to the scene of the crime and see if I can't spot something that will give me a lead. I lock up the office and start walking towards the National Catnip Bank.///Along the way, I listen to the cats on the street. Everybody seems to be in an anxious mood. By now, the news has spread far and wide.///I see a cat sitting on a bus stop bench reading a newspaper. Sure enough, the headlines are all about the burglary. This case is massive. I need to work quickly if I want to solve it first.///At nine o'clock, I arrive at the bank. It's an impressive gray stone building with tall columns and lots of steps.///The kind of building that makes you think 'wow, they've probably got really good security.' Apparently not, given the circumstances. I climb the steps and enter.///There's a wide-eyed teller working the nearest window. A large, orange cat with a small black nose set right in the middle of her rounded face. 'Good day,' I say. 'Can I ask you some questions about yesterday?'///I didn't think it was possible, but the eyes of the teller open even wider. She takes a quick glance from side to side before leaning forward, over her tall desk, towards me.///'S... Sure, but make it quick. I'm a little shook up about the whole thing, you know.'///'I understand, ma'am. Did you notice anyone acting suspicious yesterday inside the bank?' She takes a moment to think. 'Now that you mention it, there was one cat acting strange.///They had a nervous look about them. Entered the front door, looked around, lingered for ten minutes or so, then left without approaching the counter. Weird, huh? It was a light gray tabby. That's all I know.'///'Thank you, ma'am, that's very helpful. I'll get to the bottom of it.' I leave the counter and start walking around the lobby. Not three minutes into sweeping the area, I find a clump of light gray cat hair. Jackpot.///I need to get this sample in to the lab for testing and see if we can't find out the identity of the nervous cat...///To be continued!
column2302: [red]~Kitten Detective~#nl#Part 4: The Test[/red]///It's been a busy 24 hours.
